snippet.textDisplay: They essentually set it up so that you were alone in a lot of extremely creepy places with a lot of "jump out and scare you" style bad guys. You gained levels and whatnot in the game but realistically it came down mostly to upgrading your guns. So spending a lot of time leveling up like you do in a normal RPG wasn't necessarily required, but was however possible.
snippet.textOriginal: They essentually set it up so that you were alone in a lot of extremely creepy places with a lot of "jump out and scare you" style bad guys. You gained levels and whatnot in the game but realistically it came down mostly to upgrading your guns. So spending a lot of time leveling up like you do in a normal RPG wasn't necessarily required, but was however possible.
